Organisational Behaviours

This module is designed to provide the candidate with an introduction to psychological and behavioural approaches to the study of organisation behaviour incorporating basic analytical tools and concepts used from the field that encourage an understanding of the behaviour of individuals and groups in the workplace.

Learning Objectives for this module:

+  Explain the power relations in working relationships.

+  Demonstrate the ability to work with others based upon an understanding of group dynamics.

+  Identify the different factors that influence the behaviour of individuals and groups.

+  Apply the processes involved in the management of change.

+  Evaluate the different approaches to management and theories of organisation.

+  Evaluate the impact of organisational structure and culture on business success.

+  Infer the nature of organisational behaviour within the field of business.
